pbcoreDescriptionDocument.pbcoreDescription: On Feb. 23, 1987, one of the most violent events since the creation of the universe was observed. Ian Shelton, a young Canadian astronomer working on a remote mountaintop in Chile, came upon a supernova--the gargantuan explosion in which a star blows itself apart. A star blows itself apart in a nearby galaxy, and astronomers scramble to study the rare event. NOVA covers a fast-breaking science story as it is happening.
